pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.5_0: The training rule on wishing to go to the instruction
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.10_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1_0: ‘Every half-month a nun should seek two things from the Sangha of monks: asking it about the observance day and going to it for the instruction.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1_1: If she goes beyond a half-month, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.2_0: At that time the nuns did not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.3_0: But the monks complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.4_0: “How can the nuns not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction?” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns don’t do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.8_0: “... How can the nuns not do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.10_0: if she searches for a companion nun, but is unable to find one;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.14_0: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.15_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on nine, is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.4_0: there are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.5_0: The instruction to give you the instruction:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.7_0: If she thinks, “I won’t enquire about the observance day, nor ask for the instruction,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
